0.title: I would like to be the one to give a checkmate against Messi: Ronaldo
0.article_body: In a press conference, Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo said he'd like to be the one to give a checkmate against Argentina captain Lionel Messi. "Let’s see. It'd be beautiful [to win 2022 FIFA World Cup]...As it happened in chess, it'd be magic to happen in football as well," he stated. Portugal’s first group match is against Ghana on Thursday.

1.title: We are still hiring: TikTok CEO amid layoffs by major tech companies
1.article_body: TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew at a recent event said the China-based social media company is still hiring, but at a measured pace. The statement comes as major tech companies including Meta, Amazon and Twitter have laid off staff in the recent weeks. TikTok is currently in the middle of a three-year hiring push to add about 3,000 engineers worldwide.

2.title: Man seen massaging Satyendar Jain in Tihar jail in viral video is rape accused: Report
2.article_body: The man giving massage to jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in a viral video is Rinku, a prisoner in a rape case, charged under POCSO Act and IPC sections 376, 506 and 509, ANI reported quoting Tihar Jail official sources. He's not a physiotherapist, officials told ANI. This comes after AAP claimed Jain was receiving physiotherapy for a spinal injury.

3.title: Delhi Police moves court for conducting polygraph test on Aftab
3.article_body: Delhi Police has moved a court seeking permission for conducting the polygraph test on Aftab Poonawala, accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar and chopping her body into 35 pieces. Police had earlier told the court that Aftab is giving wrong information and misleading the investigation. Last week, the court allowed police to conduct a narco-analysis test on Aftab.

4.title: Got asthma attack when SRK was about to die in 'Kal Ho…': Mismatched actor
4.article_body: 'Mismatched' actor Abhinav Sharma recalled that at the age of 13-14, when he was watching 'Kal Ho Naa Ho', he got "an asthma attack when Shah Rukh Khan was about to die". He remembered that he and his family missed the ending of the film, which had upset his mother. The actor also spoke about his affection for Shah Rukh.

5.title: As a human, I'd like Argentina to lose all WC matches: Messi's ex-doctor
5.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi's former doctor Diego Schwarzstein said he'd like to see Argentina lose every match in the 2022 FIFA World Cup and get eliminated in the first round, as a "human being". "Why? I am convinced that this obscenely populist government that we have here would use the success of Argentina...to cover things up," added Schwarzstein.

6.title: Social media commentator arrested for comments against MK Stalin
6.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police arrested a political commentator, Kishore Swamy, for allegedly putting out tweets against CM MK Stalin on Chennai rain situation. He was arrested after his anticipatory bail plea was dismissed by the sessions court. "We sent him four notices but he failed to respond. We took him into our custody from Puducherry on Monday," a police officer said.

7.title: GHMC to establish 16 more multi-purpose function halls in Hyderabad
7.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has proposed to establish 16 more multi-purpose function halls in Hyderabad in addition to the existing list of nine taking the total number to 25. The total 25 function halls will cost ₹95.70 crore. These function halls will have all facilities needed for weddings like separate rooms for brides and grooms, dining area etc.

8.title: Kanye West says he's selling Adidas, Gap hoodies for $20 after firms cut ties with him
8.article_body: Giving a tour of his Los Angeles workshop, rapper Kanye West said he'll be selling hoodies from Balenciaga, Adidas, and Gap for $20. These fashion brands had cut ties with the rapper following his antisemitic comments. In the tour video, many clothes were seen labelled "Ye24", as West also confirmed his intention to run for the 2024 presidential race.

9.title: Delhi court extends Aftab Poonawala's police custody by 4 days
9.article_body: The Saket court in Delhi extended the police custody of Aftab Amin Poonawala by four days on Tuesday. Aftab is accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in May and cutting her body into pieces. He was produced before the court in a special hearing and reportedly told the court that the incident happened in heat of the moment.

10.title: TV is like comfort food, will never go out of fashion: Rupali Ganguly
10.article_body: 'Anupamaa' actress Rupali Ganguly said she hasn't "understood" the OTT world and called television similar to "comfort food". She said television will never go out of fashion because unlike some of the content on OTT space, TV can be watched with family members without feeling embarrassed. "A large chunk of our population...still not gone into the OTT zone," she said.

11.title: Nykaa stock falls over 3% after Lighthouse India stake sale report
11.article_body: The shares of Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Limited fell over 3% on Tuesday after reports of nearly 1.8 crore shares worth ₹320 crore changing hands in a block deal. Private equity firm Lighthouse India has reportedly sold the shares at a price of around ₹183.5 apiece. The shares amount to nearly 0.65% of Nykaa's overall stake.

12.title: Income Tax Dept raids several places linked to Telangana Labour Minister Malla Reddy
12.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Tuesday conducted raids at various locations belonging to the Telangana Labour Minister Chamakura Malla Reddy and his associates for alleged tax evasion. Reports said that searches are underway at several places in Rangareddy district of Hyderabad. Raids are also being conducted at locations linked to Reddy's son and son-in-law, Times Now reported.

13.title: Air India looking to hire foreign pilots for wide-body planes: Report
13.article_body: Air India plans to hire foreign pilots for its wide-body Boeing 777 planes amid a shortage of pilots as the airline is looking to expand its fleet as well as international operations, PTI reported citing sources. The Tata Group-owned airline has reportedly approached various agencies that provide expat flight crew as it looks to rope in around 100 pilots.

14.title: Farmers hit by rains shouldn't be forced to repay power bills: Maha Dy CM
14.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said on Monday that he has ordered officials of the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) to not force farmers to repay power bills, especially those who have lost their crops due to excess rains. "However, officials have been asked to collect the electricity bills from farmers for the current season only," he added.

15.title: Kanye tweets 'Shalom', Israel reacts; Musk says 'More countries should tweet like this'
15.article_body: Kanye West, who was banned from Twitter over anti-Semitic remarks, tweeted, "Shalom" on his return, to which Israel responded, "We'd very much like to be excluded from this narrative." Israel's response was a reference to Taylor Swift's statement after Kanye released 'Famous', wherein he calls her 'b***h'. Elon Musk tweeted, "Your tweets are good! More countries should tweet like this."

16.title: 72 kg of narcotics, drugs seized by authorities ahead of MCD polls
16.article_body: Ahead of the municipal polls in Delhi, authorities enforcing the model code of conduct have seized 72 kg of narcotics and drugs, officials said on Monday. "Also, 2,738 bottles of illegal liquor were seized, taking the cumulative figure to 96,085," an official statement read. MCD polls are due on December 4.

17.title: Live classes lead to hands-on learning: Scaler
17.article_body: Instructor-led live classes create an active learning environment vs self-study done online through pre-recorded lectures, said Scaler. It helps learners understand complex concepts more clearly, resolve doubts, interact with peers and apply learning in real time, Scaler shared. This combined with real-world case studies makes them become one of the most valued tech talents in the world, it added.

18.title: I'm perfectly fine, sustained minor injuries: 'Taarak...' actor Amit
18.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actor Amit Bhatt, who recently got injured on the sets of the television show, has said that he's "perfectly fine". "All the claims suggesting that I have met with a tragic accident are false," he said, adding that he sustained "very minor injuries". He shared his health update on his Instagram profile.

19.title: Pune to get 2 new crematoriums for pet, stray and zoo animals
19.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to set up two new crematoriums for pet, stray and zoo animals, in addition to the existing one. "We have identified two places - one at the Katraj zoo and the other at Bavdhan," said an official. "The PMC is providing the land while the state government is funding the crematoriums," he added.

20.title: Else can break hearts: HC as it allows marriage hall to host functions
20.article_body: The Nagpur bench of Bombay HC recently protected a marriage hall from action by Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB), saying that if scheduled functions don't take place at the venue, it can break the hearts of the bride and groom. The hall was under the scanner for not complying with rules. MPCB was asked to restore electricity and water supply.

21.title: 8 killed as small plane crashes into residential area in Colombia
21.article_body: A small plane carrying eight people crashed into a residential area of Colombia's second-largest city Medellin on Monday, killing all on board, authorities said. The aircraft had reportedly hit at least one house in the Belen Rosales area. The plane took off from the Olaya Herrera Airport in the morning and had reported an engine failure before crashing.

22.title: I was screaming, I said 'Can you please get my wife?': Glenn Maxwell on breaking leg
22.article_body: Recalling the moment he broke his leg during a friend's 50th birthday party, Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said, "I heard and felt every part of it." He added, "I was screaming a bit and [my friend] was like, 'Please tell me you're joking'." Maxwell stated, "I said, 'I'm pretty sure both the bones are broken...Can you please get my wife?'"

23.title: How much compensation will Bob Iger receive as Disney CEO?
23.article_body: Bob Iger, who has been named as CEO of The Walt Disney Company for next two years, will receive about $27 million annually as compensation. Iger will receive a base salary of $1 million and a bonus equal to that amount, the company said. In addition, he will receive stock awards with a target value of $25 million each year.

24.title: Mumbai's trans-harbour line to get one more station next year
24.article_body: The trans-harbour railway line that runs between Thane and Panvel will have a new station, Digha, which will be a part of this route in January next year, a Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation (MRVC) official said. The new station will come after Airoli and will also be part of the proposed Airoli-Kalwa elevated suburban corridor on the Central Railway line.

25.title: Bowl to the other guy: Ross Taylor on how to stop Suryakumar from scoring
25.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Ross Taylor, on being asked how New Zealand bowlers can stop Suryakumar Yadav from scoring, said, "Bowl to the other guy as much as you can." He added, "Suryakumar was hitting sixes at the MCG...if he hits it like that at McLean Park, they will be out of the ground." Suryakumar scored century in second NZ T20I.

26.title: Voters in Maha border districts get 1-day paid leave for Guj polls
26.article_body: The Maharashtra government has issued a government resolution allowing one-day paid leave for voters in border districts, like Palghar, Nashik, Nandurbar and Dhule, for Gujarat Assembly elections. "All private companies are instructed to follow this. If the order is violated, action will be taken," it said. Elections will be held in Gujarat in two phases on December 1 and 5.

27.title: 19 trains cancelled, 20 diverted after train derailment in Odisha
27.article_body: The Indian Railways cancelled 19 trains and diverted 20 others after a goods train derailed at Korai railway station in Odisha on Monday. In addition, six trains were partially cancelled. Three people were killed and four injured in the incident. The Railways arranged free road transportation for stranded passengers at Haridaspur station.

28.title: Rainbow-coloured bucket hats of female Wales fans confiscated at Qatar World Cup
28.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing pro-LGBTQ rainbow-coloured bucket hats of female Wales fans being confiscated upon their entry into the stadium for Wales-USA's 2022 FIFA World Cup match in Qatar. The Football Association of Wales is investigating the matter. "It's a shame," Wales manager Rob Page said.

29.title: World's richest man Musk's wealth drops by over $100 billion for 1st time
29.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk’s wealth declined by over $100 billion for the first time in 2022 as Tesla shares dropped to the lowest level since November 2020. Currently, Tesla CEO Musk's net worth stands at $170 billion as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, after peaking at $340 billion a little more than a year ago.

30.title: No plans to file for bankruptcy imminently: Crypto lender Genesis
30.article_body: Days after being forced to suspend customer redemptions following FTX's collapse, cryptocurrency lender Genesis said it has no plans to file for bankruptcy as it continues to have conversations with creditors. "We have no plans to file [for] bankruptcy imminently. Our goal is to resolve the current situation consensually without the need for any bankruptcy filing," a spokesperson said.

31.title: Brazil have 10 dances ready for each match: Raphinha on celebrating goals
31.article_body: Discussing his team's plans with regard to celebrating goals, Brazil and Barcelona footballer Raphinha said, "We already have dances prepared...till the 10th goal." "We have...10 dances prepared for each match...If we score more than 10...we will have to start innovating," added Raphinha. Brazil will face Serbia in their opening match of the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

32.title: BJP's allegations against AAP won't impact MCD polls: Atishi
32.article_body: AAP's Atishi said BJP’s corruption charge against her party won't impact voters in the Delhi civic polls. On being asked about the impact of BJP’s allegation that CM Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP was shielding Delhi ministers Manish Sisodia and Satyendar Jain, Atishi said, "Voters know the truth, they're not fools. The allegations levelled by BJP are not going to impact them."

33.title: Factory fire kills 36 in China; 'criminal suspects' arrested
33.article_body: At least 36 people have been killed and two others are missing after a fire broke out at a plant of a trading firm in central China, local authorities said on Tuesday. The fire, which started on Monday afternoon, took four hours to extinguish. "Criminal suspects" had been taken into custody in connection with the fire, authorities added.

34.title: Varun doesn't say bye on call, he says 'I'll call back'; call never comes: Kriti
34.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that actor Varun Dhawan does not say bye on call. "[He] only [says] 'Okay I'll just call you back haan'. And the call never comes! It's a very detached conversation at the beginning and the end. Like, sometimes, he won't say bye and he will just vanish," she added.

35.title: I steal stories, I don't write them; they're all around you: 'RRR' writer
35.article_body: 'RRR' and 'Baahubali...' writer KV Vijayendra Prasad said he does not write stories, he steals them. "Stories are there around you, be it epics like 'Mahabharat', 'Ramayan' or real-life [incidents], there are stories everywhere. You need to represent it in your unique style," he added. "I always try to create a hunger within the audience for my story," he added.

36.title: French startup Fairmat raises $35 million led by Temasek and CNP
36.article_body: French startup Fairmat, which recycles carbon fiber has secured $35 million in a Series A funding round led by Temasek and CNP (Compagnie Nationale à Portefeuille). The funding round also saw participation from Pictet Group, Singular and The Friedkin Group International, among others. The startup, founded by Benjamin Saada, has raised $45.5 million since its inception.

37.title: Centre invites bids to construct MP Chambers near new Parliament
37.article_body: The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) invited pre-qualification bids from companies for construction of MP Chambers that would have offices for all MPs as a part of redevelopment of Central Vista area. The project, estimated to cost ₹1,435 crore, would be spread over 1.18 lakh square metres in two 10-storied buildings, one two-storied building and a ground-floor utility block.

38.title: Tsunami warning issued after 7.0 magnitude earthquake hits Solomon Islands
38.article_body: A 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Solomon Islands on Tuesday, following which a tsunami warning was issued for an area of the Solomon coast within 300 kilometres of the epicentre. Eyewitnesses claimed that the shaking lasted for around 20 seconds, while some reported that the shaking hurled televisions and other items to the ground.

39.title: Iger announces Disney media sales head's exit a day after returning as CEO
39.article_body: A day after returning to The Walt Disney Company, CEO Bob Iger told employees that he would begin making operational changes at the company. Iger announced that one of the first steps would be the departure of Kareem Daniel, the Chairman of Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution. He was a long-time associate of former CEO Bob Chapek.

40.title: Single parent, divorced women are looked down upon: Malaika Arora
40.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora shared that divorced women or women who are a single parent are "looked down upon" and receive "criticism" from society. "There's someone or the other having some sort of comment and I think we need to change that," she added. Malaika said that her upcoming debut OTT series 'Moving In With Malaika' will not be scripted.

41.title: We have to be better: England coach Southgate after 6-2 win vs Iran
41.article_body: England manager Gareth Southgate said his team will have to perform "better" in their upcoming matches of the 2022 FIFA World Cup, having recorded a 6-2 win against Iran. "I am...fed up with the end of it really...It was a sticky first half...I have got to be happy but we shouldn't be conceding two goals at that stage," added Southgate.

42.title: Mumbai records coldest November day in 5 years, temperature drops to 17°C﻿
42.article_body: Mumbai recorded the coldest November day in the last five years on Monday. The temperature dropped to 17 degrees Celsius, four degrees below normal. "The dip in temperature is a result of cold northerly winds. However, easterlies from the Bay of Bengal will lead to moisture incursion and therefore temperatures are likely to rise slightly," said an IMD official.

43.title: Delhi BJP suspends 11 rebel candidates from the party for 6 years
43.article_body: Delhi BJP President Adesh Gupta has suspended 11 rebel candidates from party. The rebel candidates are reportedly contesting upcoming MCD polls against official party candidates. Amongst the suspended BJP rebels are Gajendra Daral, Lovelesh Sharma, Reenu Jain, Shama Agarwal, Virendra Agarwal, Ravindra Singh, Antim Gehlot, Poonam Choudhary, Mahavir Singh, Dharamveer Singh and Rajkumar Khurana.

44.title: Journalist detained for wearing rainbow t-shirt to FIFA World Cup stadium in Qatar
44.article_body: American journalist Grant Wahl said he was briefly detained on Monday when was entering a FIFA World Cup stadium in Qatar while wearing a rainbow shirt in support of the LGBTQ community. Sharing a picture on Twitter, he wrote that he was asked to change his t-shirt. "I'm OK...Am in the media center, still wearing my shirt," he later tweeted.

45.title: Truck driver accused in 48 car-pileup incident on Pune highway arrested
45.article_body: Pune Police has arrested the absconding truck driver, who had allegedly turned off the ignition on a downward slope on the Pune-Bengaluru highway to save fuel causing a pileup of nearly 48 vehicles on Sunday. Along with the driver Maniram Yadav, his aide  Lalit Yadav was also arrested, police added. Twenty-four vehicles were significantly damaged in the incident.

46.title: Karisma & Abhishek weren't 'made for each other' kind: Suneel Darshan
46.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan said that Abhishek Bachchan and Karisma Kapoor, who were engaged to each other, "were really not the 'made for each other' kind" pair. The filmmaker added that there was "constant bickering" among them during 'Haan...Maine Bhi Pyaar Kiya', which is their only film together. Abhishek-Karisma reportedly broke up after the film's failure at the box office.

47.title: Ukrainians likely to live with blackouts until March-end: Energy provider
47.article_body: Ukrainians will most likely live with blackouts until at least March-end, the head of a major Ukrainian energy provider said. Workers are rushing to complete repairs before the winter cold arrives, Sergey Kovalenko, CEO of YASNO energy company, added. Earlier, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy had said half of the country's energy infrastructure has been damaged by Russian attacks.

48.title: ₹8.93 lakh cash stolen from petrol pump in Pune
48.article_body: An unidentified person allegedly stole ₹8.93 lakh cash from a petrol pump in Pune's Chikhali between 10.30 pm on Saturday and 6 am on Sunday. The staffers of the petrol pump had reportedly collected and stored the money in the cash room but the sum was missing from the locker in the morning.

49.title: AAP MLA thrashed over MCD polls ticket distribution issue, video surfaces
49.article_body: Matiala AAP MLA Gulab Singh Yadav was thrashed allegedly by party workers on Monday in Delhi, a video of which has surfaced. Police said there was an altercation over the issue of ticket distribution which resulted in the alleged manhandling of Yadav by some party workers. The clip shows Yadav running to save himself and angry people following him.

50.title: SUV crashes through window of Apple store in US; 1 dead, 16 injured
50.article_body: An SUV crashed through the front window of an Apple store on Monday in Massachusetts, killing one person and injuring 16 others. The car is said to have gone straight to the back of the store, pinning some shoppers and employees against the wall. Meanwhile, Apple released a statement saying it was "devastated by the shocking events".

51.title: Speeding car rams into 3 vehicles in Pune's Chakan; 3 injured
51.article_body: Three people were injured after a speeding car rammed into two bikes and a car coming from the opposite direction in Pune's Chakan. The car driver escaped from the spot after the accident. Prima facie, police suspect it may be a case of drink and drive. One of the injured people was critically wounded and was taken to a hospital.

52.title: Saudi Arabia executed 12 people in 10 days by sword after 2-year break: Reports
52.article_body: Saudi Arabia executed 12 people in 10 days, most of which were beheadings with a sword, for drug offences after a two-year hiatus, said reports. Those executed reportedly included three Pakistanis, four Syrians, two Jordanians and three Saudis. With this the total number of people executed this year is at least 132, those of 2020 and 2021 combined, AFP reported.

53.title: You can't give bullsh*t to audience, need 3-4 Drishyams to revive B'wood: Ajay
53.article_body: While talking about reviving Bollywood from the box office slump, actor Ajay Devgn said that the industry needs three to four Drishyams. "I feel it is not very easy to make entertaining films...you have to keep the audiences engaged for two and a half hours. And audiences have become very smart, so you can't just give them bullsh*t," he added.

54.title: Twitter is done with layoffs & is actively hiring again, Musk tells staff: Report
54.article_body: Elon Musk has told employees that Twitter is done with layoffs and is actively recruiting for roles in engineering and sales, as per a report. Musk’s comments were reportedly made the same day that an unspecified number of jobs were cut from Twitter’s sales department. Musk also said that Twitter's headquarters won’t be moved from San Francisco, the report added.

55.title: Musk pauses relaunch of $8 per month Twitter blue tick verification plan
55.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Tuesday announced that the social media platform is holding off the relaunch of Twitter Blue "until there is high confidence of stopping impersonation". Twitter recently announced the blue tick subscription service, which costs $8 per month for a verification badge. Musk added that Twitter will probably use different colour check for organisations and individuals.

56.title: BMC sanctions ₹571 crore to reconstruct 2 bridges in Mumbai
56.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has sanctioned ₹571 crore for the reconstruction of two bridges which were declared unsafe in Mumbai. While ₹196 crore has been sanctioned for Reay Road bridge, ₹375 crore has been sanctioned for Tilak bridge. The Reay Road bridge has already been demolished while Tilak bridge will be demolished after the construction of the new bridge.

57.title: Had country-made liquor: Driver of truck that killed 12 in Bihar's Vaishali
57.article_body: The driver of a truck that killed 12 people in Bihar's Vaishali said that he had consumed country-made liquor at a stop. He told news agency ANI that the accident happened when he attempted to overtake another truck. There were children amongst the deceased, reports said, adding that they had gathered to offer prayers to a deity.

58.title: Rumours of bomb at Charminar surface as anti-sabotage checking conducted
58.article_body: Rumours of a bomb at Hyderabad's Charminar surfaced on Monday after the Bomb Disposal and Detection Squad of the Hyderabad Police conducted an anti-sabotage check. Reports said that three teams of the bomb squad, along with sniffer dogs, reached Charminar on Monday and checked the inside and the surroundings of the monument for an hour.

59.title: Gurugram civic body maps 300 garbage vulnerable points across city
59.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has mapped 300 garbage vulnerable points that have turned into dump yards across the city. This comes after MCG asked Ecogreen to only collect segregated waste from Monday. Some people have refused to segregate waste citing long working hours and lack of house help and are throwing waste in open areas, an MCG official said.

60.title: I can't think of a worse curse than living forever: World's richest man Elon Musk
60.article_body: The world's richest man, Elon Musk, tweeted, "I can't think of a worse curse than living forever." His tweet came in response to a person's tweet about the logarithmic timeline of an expanding universe. Several Twitter users reacted to the conversation, with one saying, "With the way the world's going, living just another 200 years might be pretty awful."

61.title: Elon Musk fires more employees from Twitter's sales team: Report
61.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk has fired more employees from the company's sales side, Bloomberg reported. The latest layoffs come after Musk asked Twitter's employees to commit to his more "hardcore" version of the company or leave. According to reports, sales employees signed on to Musk's vision in greater numbers than workers on the technical side, which saw mass resignations.

62.title: USA, Wales deliver first draw of 2022 FIFA World Cup as match ends 1-1
62.article_body: USA and Wales played out the first draw of 2022 FIFA World Cup as their opening match of the tournament ended in a 1-1 draw. USA's Tim Weah opened the scoring in the match in the 36th minute. Wales captain Gareth Bale equalised in the 82nd minute by converting a penalty following a foul by USA defender Walker Zimmerman.

63.title: Germany offers Eurofighters, Patriot air defence system to Poland
63.article_body: Germany has offered Eurofighter combat jets and Patriot air defence missiles to Poland to help secure its airspace, as per German news reports published on Monday. This comes after a missile hit a Polish village near the Ukrainian border last week. The missile appeared to have been fired by Ukraine's air defences rather than a Russian strike, NATO had said.

64.title: Want to be the best and win every tournament in tennis: Djokovic
64.article_body: Novak Djokovic said he is driven by his love and passion for the sport and he wants to "win every tournament". "Why not try it? Why not dream about it? I want to be the best...I don't think that's not humble," said Djokovic. The 21-time Grand Slam champion beat Casper Ruud 7-5, 6-3 to win his sixth ATP Finals title.

65.title: Regret the comments I made against Verstappen after Brazilian Grand Prix: Perez
65.article_body: Red Bull driver Sergio Perez said he regrets the comments he made against teammate Max Verstappen after the Brazilian Grand Prix. "I am back with Max in the relationship we used to have...we could have handled the situation better," said Perez. Current world champion Verstappen had refused to allow Perez to pass him and gain points during the race.

66.title: Made all mistakes we could during the Abu Dhabi GP: Mercedes F1 boss
66.article_body: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff said his team made "all the mistakes you can make" during the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. "That was really not good...Third quickest...It was a precise summary of the season, and here we are," said Wolff. British driver George Russell finished fifth in the race, while Lewis Hamilton had to retire due to mechanical failure.

67.title: Won't allow Haryana govt new assembly building in Chandigarh: AAP
67.article_body: The AAP said Punjab has sole rights over Chandigarh and Haryana will not be allowed to construct an additional legislative assembly building in the city. "Haryana will not be given an inch of land in Chandigarh," said AAP. Haryana has sought a 10-acre plot adjacent to the traffic light at Madhya Marg in the city for the new assembly building.

68.title: India stands in solidarity: Jaishankar as 162 killed in Indonesia earthquake
68.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, expressing grief over the loss of lives in Indonesia's West Java after an earthquake, on Monday tweeted, "India stands in solidarity with Indonesia at this difficult time." "My thoughts are with the bereaved families. Wish the injured [persons] a speedy recovery," he added. The 5.6-magnitude earthquake led to the loss of at least 162 lives.

69.title: Man who threatened to kill Rahul Gandhi in MP identified: Police
69.article_body: Police said they have identified the man who threatened to kill Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Kamal Nath and carry out blasts when the Bharat Jodo Yatra goes to Indore. Police said the man moves around like a nomad and writes letters from different districts under fake names. Police added that they also had photos of the man.

70.title: Fans unable to access tickets after FIFA's ticketing app crashes
70.article_body: Thousands of fans were unable to access tickets to the FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar after FIFA's ticketing app crashed. Tickets on the app "disappeared" from accounts and we were unable to transfer tickets to other individuals accompanying us, an affected fan said. Fans were then instructed to reach Ticket Resolution Points, causing long lines.

71.title: Book tickets for Ram Mandir inauguration: Amit Shah to Rahul Gandhi
71.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah asked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to book tickets for the inauguration of the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya. "Nobody had the guts to (rebuild it) since Babar destroyed it. It is...(PM) Narendra Modi who laid the foundation stone," said Shah. He added that Pakistani infiltrators "used to take the heads of our jawans" during the UPA regime.

72.title: CA Swift Investments sells 2.5% stake in Delhivery for ₹607 crore
72.article_body: CA Swift Investments offloaded a 2.5% stake in supply chain company Delhivery for ₹607.38 crore through the open market transaction. According to official data, CA Swift Investments sold 18.4 million shares at an average price of ₹330.02 apiece. Morgan Stanley picked up about 4.9 million shares for ₹160 crore, data provided by stock exchanges showed.

73.title: Injured owl rescued by forest dept handed over to Lucknow zoo
73.article_body: An injured mottled wood owl rescued by forest department officials was handed over to the Lucknow zoo. The bird was injured at Scooter India crossing in Lucknow's Sarojini Nagar area and the city police informed the forest department about it. A team was sent by Divisional Forest Officer Ravi Kumar Singh to rescue the owl and arrange for its treatment.

74.title: Khalistani terrorist carrying ₹5 lakh reward arrested by NIA
74.article_body: Most-wanted Khalistani terrorist Kulwinderjit Singh alias Khanpuria was arrested at the Delhi airport after he arrived from Bangkok, an official from the National Investigation Agency (NIA) said. Singh has been associated with terror outfits such as Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) and the Khalistan Liberation Force (KLF). He was carrying a reward of ₹5 lakh, the official added.

75.title: Punjab govt treating cases of illicit liquor trade with 'kids' glove': SC
75.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday said Punjab government is treating cases of illicit liquor trade in the state "with kids' glove". It appears no serious efforts have been made to reach the real culprits who're in business of manufacturing and transporting illicit liquor, SC said. SC also directed the government to inform it of details concerning FIRs lodged in this regard.

76.title: 25-yr-old social media influencer 'Rowdy Bhati' dies in car crash in Gr Noida
76.article_body: A 25-year-old social media celebrity whose Instagram name is 'Rowdy Bhati' has died in a car crash in Greater Noida, police said on Monday. Rohit Bhati, who was from UP's Bulandshahr, was killed after the car he and two of his friends were in, crashed into a tree. His friends are undergoing treatment at hospitals in Greater Noida and Delhi.

77.title: This Argentina team reminds me that of 2014 squad: Messi ahead of WC opener
77.article_body: Ahead of Argentina against Saudi Arabia match in FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar, Argentina captain Lionel Messi said his current team reminds him of the 2014 squad. "It was a very similar strong squad. We were very united, we were very clear about what we had to do on a pitch," he added. Messi-led Argentina finished runners-up in 2014.

78.title: Nothing surprising: Jaffer on Ishan's selection over Gill in 2nd T20I vs NZ
78.article_body: While justifying Ishan Kishan's selection over Shubman Gill in India's playing XI for second T20I against New Zealand, Wasim Jaffer said it's "nothing surprising". "Because Ishan played T20Is before...he did well, so it makes sense to give him a go," he added. Before the second T20I, Kishan had played in 19 T20Is. Gill is yet to make his T20I debut.

79.title: 75-yr-old man killed, another injured over land dispute in Madhya Pradesh
79.article_body: A 75-year-old man was killed and another person was injured after being allegedly attacked by a group of people over a land dispute in Atrar village in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur district. The son of the deceased, Ghanshyam Mishra, alleged that his father was attacked with sticks. The main accused has been identified as Ram Narayan Mishra, police said.

80.title: Gunmen abduct over 100 people from 4 villages in northwest Nigeria
80.article_body: More than 100 people, including women and children, were abducted by gunmen from four villages in Nigeria's northwestern Zamfara state on Sunday, authorities and residents said. Such mass abductions by armed groups are said to have become endemic in northwest Nigeria. Zamfara's Information Minister Ibrahim Dosara accused the gunmen of using abductees as human shields against military air strikes.

81.title: Farah Khan, Johny Lever attend Tabassum's prayer meet in Mumbai
81.article_body: Several celebrities from the film industry, including Farah Khan, Johny Lever and Jaaved Jaaferi, attended the prayer meeting held in honour of late actress Tabassum on Monday. Neil Nitin Mukesh, Moushumi Chatterjee, Alka Yagnik and Raza Murad also paid their last respects to the actress. Tabassum passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest.

82.title: Top Russian official warns of possible nuclear mishap at Zaporizhzhia
82.article_body: Russian state-run atomic energy agency Rosatom's chief warned on Monday that there was a risk of a nuclear accident at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant following renewed shelling over the weekend. Alexei Likhachev further said it appeared Kyiv was willing to "accept" a "small nuclear accident". Moscow and Kyiv have accused each other of shelling the plant for months now.

83.title: 95% of players would agree Messi is the greatest player: Croatia's Kramaric
83.article_body: Croatia forward Andrej Kramaric said he will be cheering for Argentina in ongoing FIFA World Cup 2022 as no one will ever see a player like Lionel Messi again. "I think 95% of players would agree Messi is the greatest player ever to play this game," he added. Kramaric stated that he thinks Brazil will win the tournament.

84.title: Big things await: Karthik on Jagadeesan's record-breaking 277 in 50-over match
84.article_body: Reacting to Tamil Nadu wicketkeeper-opener Narayan Jagadeesan's record-breaking knock in men's List A cricket, Dinesh Karthik took to Twitter and wrote, "World record alert. What an amazing effort by Jagadeesan. Couldn't be happier for him. Big things await." Jagadeesan scored 277 runs off 141 balls in a Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Arunachal Pradesh at M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Monday.

85.title: Beautiful that many people outside Argentina want us to be champions: Messi
85.article_body: Argentina skipper Lionel Messi said it's a beautiful thing that many non-Argentinians want them to be the champions at the FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "I'm grateful for the love I've received...during my career, and here in Qatar, it's another example of that...This is probably my last WC, my last chance to achieve this great dream," Messi said.

86.title: Nicholas Pooran resigns as West Indies ODI and T20I captain
86.article_body: Nicholas Pooran has resigned as West Indies ODI and T20I captain, citing "enormous disappointment" caused by West Indies' exit from T20 World Cup 2022 in first round. "This is not me giving up. I remain ambitious and still view the captaincy...as an honour that is bestowed upon you," he said. Pooran led West Indies in 23 T20Is and 17 ODIs.

87.title: Aamir Khan is a film school, learnt a lot from him: 'Laal...' director
87.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan in an interview called Aamir Khan a "film school" and said that he has learnt a lot from the actor. "Recently I was directing a music video and I was stuck. I thought...how he'd have done it. [He's]...my guru," Advait said, adding, "He genuinely listens and he's open, and that's something...I've tried to become."

88.title: Varun was never on my radar for 'October': Director Shoojit Sircar
88.article_body: Director Shoojit Sircar revealed that Varun Dhawan wasn't on his "radar" for his film 'October'. He added that the actor wanted to work with him. Shoojit further said when Varun came to his office, he was "quite clumsy". "I was looking for...certain kind of that clumsiness...And somehow, he was there and I felt...he was doing the right thing," said Shoojit.

89.title: Anyone can do negative politics but Rahul did positive politics: CM Baghel
89.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that anyone can do negative politics but Congress MP Rahul Gandhi did positive politics. CM Baghel further added that those who used to question Rahul's leadership ability, had their mouths shut. "Today the Chhattisgarh model of Congress is in discussion all over the country, while Gujarat's model has failed," CM Baghel added.

90.title: Pak Army Chief's family members became billionaires in last 6 years: Report
90.article_body: Pakistan Army Chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa's family members became billionaires during his six-year tenure, an investigative report by Pakistani website Fact Focus claimed. The current market value of the known assets and businesses of Bajwas, both within and outside Pakistan, amounts to PKR 12.7 billion. The family members own farmhouses in Pakistan and foreign countries, the report added.

91.title: Cong insults tribals, mocked me for wearing tribal attire: PM Modi
91.article_body: While addressing a rally in Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi said that Congress remained unaware of the existence of tribal people. "Even today, Congress leaders make fun of me for wearing tribal attire," the PM said. He added it was the BJP government, which carved out a separate ministry for the tribal people and allocated a budget for their welfare.

92.title: Iran protests like 'popular uprising', no danger to regime yet: Israeli spy chief
92.article_body: Israel's military intelligence chief said on Monday that the anti-government protests in Iran were starting to resemble "a popular uprising" but he could see "no real danger to the regime" thus far. "When you look at...the damage to national institutions, to symbols of the state..., there is something...happening...that is greatly troubling the [Iranian] regime," Major-General Aharon Haliva added.

93.title: 'Kaithi' is one of the most important films in my career: Karthi
93.article_body: Actor Karthi, who recently featured in 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', said filming of the sequel to his 2019 film 'Kaithi' will "hopefully" start in 2023. "'Kaithi' is...one of the [most] important films in my career. It came to me as a small idea but the moment I listened to it, I knew it was a big action film," he further added.

94.title: Go from here, says Raj Minister to collector using phone at event
94.article_body: Rajasthan minister Ramesh Meena asked the Bikaner District Collector to "go from" a public event on Monday for being preoccupied with his phone instead of paying attention to issues he was raising. "When a collector does not listen to the minister, how will he listen to the general public and how will their grievances be resolved?" Meena asked.

95.title: Protesting naxals burn 5 vehicles, 4 mobile towers in Chhattisgarh
95.article_body: Naxals set fire to five vehicles and four mobile towers in the Antagarh region of Chhattisgarh on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday. The Kanker SP said the Naxals were protesting the death of two Naxalites in an alleged encounter. The extremists also blocked a highway by felling trees and set fire to a JCB, grader, tractor and bus.

96.title: 2 dead as car catches fire after crashing into tractor-trolley in UP
96.article_body: Two persons were charred to death when their car caught fire after crashing into a tractor-trolley, which had already met with an accident, on Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Monday. The car was moving towards Agra when it rammed the tractor-trolley, which had collided with a truck. Two other passengers of the car were able to escape to safety.

97.title: I was paid ₹700 for my debut film 'Ankur': Dalip Tahil
97.article_body: Actor Dalip Tahil, when asked how much he was paid for his debut film 'Ankur', said, "I think I was paid ₹700." "It was a lot for a low-budget production, funded by NFDC. Shyam Benegal (director) looked after me very well," he added. The film, which was released in 1974, also featured Shabana Azmi and Anant Nag.

98.title: Focus on improving drag-flick, goalkeeping skills: Dilip Tirkey to members
98.article_body: Hockey India President Dilip Tirkey has asked members' units to start work on improving drag-flick and goalkeeping skills at the grassroots level. "Drag-flickers and goalkeepers at the junior level still need vast improvement," Tirkey said. He added, "The drag-flicking technique has become one of the most thrilling aspects...[and] there is a growing importance of having an agile goalkeeper."

99.title: All 9 accused in Morbi bridge collapse case apply for bail
99.article_body: All nine accused in the Morbi bridge collapse case that killed 135 people, including 55 children, have applied for bail. The latest bail application, moved on November 19, was by Devang Parmar of Dev Prakash Fabrication, the firm sub-contracted by Oreva for the bridge's restoration. Parmar's father Prakash was the first to apply for bail on November 11.

100.title: Pak's 'enemy' agencies after Imran Khan's life: Interior Minister
100.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah has said that the country's former PM Imran Khan faces a threat from "every enemy agency of Pakistan". He added that the entire blame would fall on the Army, ISI, PM Shehbaz Sharif, and Sanaullah himself if anything happened to Khan. "If...something happens to him (Imran), he'll be a source of chaos, anarchy," Sanaullah stated.

101.title: British PM Rishi Sunak unveils plan to bring young tech talent to UK
101.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak launched a new programme to identify and attract 100 young talents in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to the country. Pledging to create "one of the world's most attractive visa regimes for entrepreneurs and highly skilled people", he said, "We cannot allow the world's top AI talent to be drawn to America or China."

102.title: Cure to BJP's ailment of being obsessed with Yadav family is defeat: Akhilesh
102.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that the cure for BJP's ailment of being obsessed with the Yadav family is defeat by a record margin in the upcoming Mainpuri bypoll. "If we (Yadavs) part ways then false publicity is done that there is a feud in the family. If we stay together, then they cry 'parivaarvaadi' (dynasts)," Akhilesh said.

103.title: Decision on app-based auto services by Nov 25: K'taka govt to HC
103.article_body: The Karnataka government informed the High Court that it will decide on app-based auto-rickshaw services by November 25. Additionally, the state government also asked the court to not decide on rate hikes sought by the service providers till the decision was made. The government told the court that the aggregators were over-charging and not following rates fixed by authorities.

104.title: Iran goalkeeper suffers head injury during FIFA WC match, carried off on stretcher
104.article_body: Iran goalkeeper Alireza Beiranvand suffered a head injury after colliding with his teammate Majid Hosseini during their FIFA World Cup 2022 opener against England. The 30-year-old was carried off the field on a stretcher after spending several minutes on the pitch receiving treatment. He was replaced by Seyed Hossein Hosseini in the 20th minute of the match.

105.title: BJP MLA puts Prez Murmu's photo on bindi to protest against TMC leader
105.article_body: BJP MLA Agnimitra Paul tweeted a picture of herself wearing a bindi with an image of President Droupadi Murmu's picture on it, as a mark of protest against TMC leader Akhil Giri. "The face of the fight of tribal women of India," Paul wrote. In a video, Giri was heard saying, "How does our President look" and was subsequently criticised.

106.title: Air India plans to hire around 100 expat pilots for wide-body planes: Report
106.article_body: Air India plans to hire around 100 expat pilots for its wide-body Boeing 777 planes as it is facing a shortage of pilots, according to a report. The carrier has reportedly approached various agencies that provide expat flight crew to airlines. The report said the plans to expand its fleet and international operations have contributed to airline's pilot shortage.

107.title: We'll miss you: Germany's Zverev to compatriot Vettel on his F1 retirement
107.article_body: German tennis player Alexander Zverev took to Instagram Stories after compatriot Sebastian Vettel's retirement from Formula One and wrote, "We will miss you." Earlier, the four-time F1 world champion wrote, "Thank you for the support, the messages, the letters and all the love." Vettel finished 10th in the final race of his career at Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday.

108.title: Maharashtra appoints 2 ministers to oversee border dispute with K'taka
108.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Monday appointed ministers Chandrakant Patil and Shambhuraj Desai to coordinate with the legal team on the border dispute between Maharashtra and Karnataka. The state has appointed senior advocate Vaidyanathan to represent Maharashtra in the case in the Supreme Court. Patil is the higher and technical education minister.

109.title: Smell that made 50 Hyd college students ill came from garbage: Police
109.article_body: Students from Hyderabad's Kasturba Gandhi Degree and PG College for Women, where nearly 50 individuals fell ill due to a foul smell, claimed it was due to a reaction in their chemistry lab. The police stated that the foul smell came from nearby garbage being moved. The college management has reportedly dissuaded students from sharing details of the incident online.

110.title: Don't feel exhausted body-wise in this season's end: Oldest ATP Finals champ Novak
110.article_body: Novak Djokovic, who tied Roger Federer for most ATP Finals titles after lifting his sixth title on Sunday, said body-wise he doesn't feel as exhausted at the end of this season as compared to previous ones. The 35-year-old is the oldest champion in tournament history. Djokovic was seen shaking and gasping for breath against Daniil Medvedev in Red Group match.

111.title: Trolling initially was startling, overwhelming, demoralizing: Malaika
111.article_body: Malaika Arora, speaking about social media trolls, said that it affects many people around her. "It affects family and friends. They are human," she stated. Malaika added, "Initially, it did affect me a lot...the initial thing was a bit startling, overwhelming and demoralizing but I think with time you kind of become hardened."

112.title: Varun & I weren't really friends in beginning of 'Dilwale' shoot: Kriti
112.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon, speaking about her friendship with actor Varun Dhawan, said that they both were not really friends at the beginning of the 'Dilwale' shoot. "We became closer friends towards the end of the shoot," she added. Both worked together in 'Dilwale' for the first time. The duo will share the screen in the upcoming film 'Bhediya'.

113.title: Cong oblivious to the existence of tribals in India: PM Modi
113.article_body: PM Narendra Modi alleged that Congress leaders are oblivious to the existence of tribals despite tribals living in the country since Lord Ram and Lord Krishna. "Congress leaders never knew that Adivasis exist...It was Ataljee's government...which carved out a separate ministry...for their welfare," PM added. He also said that Adivasis cannot expect Congress to improve their condition.

114.title: 3 more countries at risk of currency crisis after Pakistan, Sri Lanka: Nomura
114.article_body: Financial holding company Nomura Holdings has said that the Czech Republic, Romania and Hungary face the risk of exchange-rate crises over the next year as fiscal and external challenges mount. The warning is based on an analysis of eight indicators including foreign exchange reserves and real short-term interest rates. Egypt, Sri Lanka, Turkey and Pakistan have already experienced such crises.

115.title: Death toll in Indonesia earthquake rises to 162; over 13,000 people displaced
115.article_body: The death toll from a 5.6-magnitude earthquake in Indonesia on Monday has risen to 162, regional governor Ridwan Kamil said. Over 13,000 people have been displaced due to the earthquake, Kamil added. Further, more than 2,200 homes have been damaged. The epicentre of the earthquake was located near the West Java town of Cianjur.

116.title: Hockey WC 1998 is one of best tournaments I've ever played: Ex-Dutch skipper
116.article_body: Ex-Dutch skipper Stephan Veen said that the men's hockey World Cup 1998 in Netherlands' Utrecht is one of the best tournaments he has ever played in. "Playing for your home crowd is the best thing you can experience...People are still talking about that tournament...They transformed a soccer stadium into a field hockey stadium [in Utrecht]," 52-year-old Veen said.

117.title: Work on Hyd's Shilpa flyover completed, to be inaugurated soon
117.article_body: The four-lane bi-directional flyover from Shilpa Layout- Outer Ring Road (ORR) near Gachibowli Junction in Hyderabad has been completed. Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) Mayor Gadwal Vijayalaxmi, along with other officials, visited the flyover on Monday. Reports claim the project, which comes under the Strategic Road Development Plan, will be open to the public by November end.

118.title: Govt norms against fake reviews on e-commerce sites to kick in Nov 25
118.article_body: The Centre announced new guidelines to curb fake online reviews and ratings which will come into effect from November 25. E-commerce platforms have to voluntarily disclose all paid consumer reviews of products and services offered by them. The government barred reviews that "have been purchased and/or written by individuals employed for that purpose by the supplier or third party concerned".

119.title: Plea in HC seeks CBI probe in Shraddha Walkar's murder case
119.article_body: Advocate Joshini Tuli has filed a plea in Delhi High Court seeking transfer of probe in Shraddha Walkar's murder case from Delhi Police to CBI. The plea said the investigation by police "cannot be efficiently carried out due to administrative/staff paucity". The plea further stated that the crime scenes are being contaminated by public and media personnel on daily basis.

120.title: Punish parents of rapists, murderers too along with convicts: BJP MLA
120.article_body: BJP MLA from Madhya Pradesh, Akash Vijayvargiya, on Monday said parents of rapists and murderers must also be punished for at least one to three years along with their convicted children.  "It's the parents' lookout to make their children responsible citizens with good character and culture...If they do something bad, parents are responsible for it," Vijayvargiya said.

121.title: Suryakumar's 111* is one of the best I've seen in New Zealand: Taylor
121.article_body: Calling Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 111(51) in Mount Maunganui "unbelievable", ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor said the India batter's innings in the second T20I is one of the best he has seen on New Zealand soil. "He takes calculated risks...he played really good cricketing shots," Ross added. Suryakumar hit 11 fours and seven sixes during his second T20I ton.

122.title: No action against Morbi tragedy culprits as they're linked to BJP: Rahul
122.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said no action has been taken against the "real culprits" behind last month's collapse of a suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi. "Will nothing happen to them because they share a good relationship with the BJP?" he added. "They arrested chowkidars (watchmen) and put them behind bars," Gandhi further said.

123.title: Satyendar Jain has lost 28 kg since being jailed: His lawyers
123.article_body: AAP leader Satyendar Jain's lawyers have alleged that Tihar jail authorities have stopped providing him food items as per his religious beliefs and he has lost 28 kg since being jailed. His lawyers said Jain isn't having cooked food, pulses, grains and milk products since he isn't able to visit temple. Jain is in custody in a money laundering case.

124.title: Twitter users troll 'Adipurush' over VFX of 'HanuMan', say 'It's so much better'
124.article_body: Several Twitter users trolled the VFX of Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan's 'Adipurush', which is reportedly made on a reported budget of ₹500 crore, after the teaser of 'HanuMan' was released on Monday. One of the users tweeted, "The VFX...CGI are so much better than 'Adipurush'." 'Adipurush' release was postponed after the film's teaser was trolled over its VFX.

125.title: Raut's 'hypocritical' Hindu attitude is condemnable: BJP's Rane
125.article_body: BJP's Nitesh Rane on Monday said that Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's "hypocritical" Hindu attitude is condemnable. Rane's remark came after Raut lauded Congress' Rahul Gandhi in a tweet, despite his comments on Veer Savarkar. "Now their true love has come out of the pretence. He has real loyalty to those who criticise Savarkar," Rane said.

126.title: L’Oréal appoints Aseem Kaushik as Managing Director for India
126.article_body: L’Oréal has announced the appointment of Aseem Kaushik as the Managing Director for India. He has succeeded Amit Jain, who will retire by the end of this year. Kaushik has been with the company for 27 years and held several leadership positions within the group. Most recently, he led international teams in PPD (Professional Products Division).

127.title: 4 Russian 'torture' sites found in the city of Kherson: Ukraine
127.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General's office on Monday said that it had identified four locations where Russian troops "brutally tortured" people in the recently-liberated city of Kherson. Russian forces set up "pseudo-law enforcement agencies" in detention centres and a police station, it added. Russian officials also allegedly left behind paperwork documenting the functioning of the detention sites.

128.title: It has been a year of many highs and lows: World no. 3 Casper Ruud
128.article_body: Casper Ruud said he has overachieved in 2022 by his own estimation. He won three Tour-level titles this season and reached an additional four finals at ATP Finals, US Open, French Open and Miami Open. "It's been a year of many highs, some really big highs. Of course, some lows," he added. Ruud finished the season at world number three.

129.title: Jindal Steel and Power wins bid to build Botswana's coal power plant
129.article_body: Jindal Steel and Power has been picked by Botswana to build a 300 megawatt coal power plant in the country. Jindal will finance the power plant construction and will recoup investments from selling electricity to the Botswana Power Corporation (BPC), the terms of which are yet to be negotiated. Initially, four companies were shortlisted for the contract.

130.title: Essar Group becomes debt-free after repaying $25 billion debt
130.article_body: Essar Group announced that it has become debt-free, having settled the remainder of its $25 billion debt after the sale of two ports and a power plant to ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel (AM/NS) for $2.05 billion. Essar has sold some of its assets in sectors such as telecom, oil refining and steel over the years to settle its $25 billion debt.

131.title: Adani Group's ₹493 cr offer for 26% stake in NDTV to launch tomorrow
131.article_body: Adani Group's ₹493 crore-open offer to buy an additional 26% stake in media firm NDTV from the market will launch on November 22. The offer to acquire 1.67 crore equity shares at an offer price of ₹294 per share will close on December 5. In August, the Adani group acquired a 29.18% stake in NDTV.

132.title: International arrivals in India don't need to fill Air Suvidha forms from tonight
132.article_body: In a further relaxation of COVID-19 guidelines for international arrivals in India, the government has ended the rule of mandatorily filling up self-declaration forms on the Air Suvidha portal. The new rule comes into effect on November 22 from 00.01 hours IST onward or Monday midnight. The rule could be reviewed later based on the COVID-19 situation.

133.title: After 'Hera Pheri 3', Firoz to make 'Welcome 3' without Akshay: Report
133.article_body: Producer Firoz Nadiadwala has reportedly decided to make 'Welcome 3' and 'Awara Paagal Deewana 2' without Akshay Kumar. According to a source quoted by Bollywood Hungama, Firoz was "disappointed" after Akshay claimed he opted out of 'Hera Pheri 3' due to creative differences. However, Firoz roped in Kartik Aaryan as Akshay quoted a high price of ₹90 crore, report said.

134.title: Ukraine evacuating civilians from Kherson, Mykolaiv for winter
134.article_body: Ukraine has started evacuating civilians from the recently-liberated areas of the Kherson region and the province of Mykolaiv, officials said on Monday. Authorities believe that the damage to Ukraine's infrastructure will make the upcoming winter unbearable for people in these areas. Residents have been advised to move to central and western parts of Ukraine, said Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk.

135.title: Lighthouse India to sell stake worth ₹320 crore in Nykaa: Reports
135.article_body: Lighthouse India is reportedly planning to sell a stake worth ₹320 crore in FSN E-Commerce Ventures, the owner of Nykaa. The shares would be offered at a price of around ₹183.5 apiece, marking a discount of nearly 2% against the last closing price. The sellers would reportedly offer a total of 1.8 crore shares in the block trade.

136.title: England record their 2nd biggest win in FIFA World Cup history, beat Iran 6-2
136.article_body: England defeated Iran 6-2 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Monday, recording their second-biggest win in FIFA World Cup history. Jude Bellingham opened the scoring for England, while Bukayo Saka scored twice, and Raheem Sterling, Marcus Rashford and Jack Grealish scored one goal each. England's biggest win in FIFA World Cup had come against Panama (6-1) in 2018.

137.title: Young fan breaks security cordon at Big B's home, falls to his feet; actor shares pics
137.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan took to his blog to reveal that when he was greeting his fans at his home 'Jalsa' on Sunday, a young fan broke the cordon and rushed to touch his feet. Sharing pictures, Bachchan wrote, "It leaves me in a swell of...aqua when in solitude...what how when why...me!" The fan also gifted a sketch to Bachchan.

138.title: Machine Gun Kelly wears suit covered in inches-long gunmetal spikes; pics viral
138.article_body: American rapper Colson Baker, known professionally as Machine Gun Kelly, wore a purple Dolce & Gabbana suit covered in several inches long spikes made of gunmetal to the American Music Awards. Addressing his outfit choice on the stage, the rapper jokingly said that the suit was "hard to pee in." He won the Favorite Rock Artist award at the event.

139.title: Difference between my parties & other parties is guest list: Ira Khan
139.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan took to Instagram and shared a video from her engagement party. Along with the video, Ira wrote, "The main difference between my parties and other people's parties is the guest list." Aamir, Reena Dutta, Mansoor Khan, Kiran Rao, Imran Khan and actress Fatima Sana Shaikh were among others who attended Ira's engagement party.

140.title: Will fast unto death till govt accepts demands: Farmer leader Dallewal
140.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Sidhupur) President Jagjit Singh Dallewal said he would continue his fast unto death till the Punjab government agreed to the farmers' demands. The farmers are demanding increased compensation for government-acquired land, crop damage and cancellation of cases. Dallewal accused AAP of acting the same way as BJP during the farmers' protest in Delhi.

141.title: Chennai police throw baby shower for constable at police station
141.article_body: Officials of a police station in Chennai organised a baby shower for a seven-month pregnant female constable. The constable was not able to reach her hometown in Tiruvannamalai for a baby shower due to personal reasons. Police officials of the K2 Ayanavaram Police Station also provided free meals to everyone including those who came to file complaints.

142.title: Priest, his wife injured as petrol bomb hurled at him in Rajasthan
142.article_body: An elderly priest and his wife received burn injuries after a group of around eight to 10 people allegedly hurled a petrol bomb at him in Rajasthan's Rajsamand district, officials said on Monday. Deogarh SHO said some of the people allegedly involved in the incident have been rounded up for questioning and the matter is being investigated.

143.title: Kerala govt can't remove me as Chancellor of universities: Guv Khan
143.article_body: Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said the LDF government in Kerala only "works for its cadre". "Universities have to be free of executive interferences, and under-qualified and unqualified will not be appointed," added Khan on the controversy over appointments to state universities. He further said the state government can't remove him as Chancellor of universities, as it is "beyond their power".

144.title: I hope to get exposure of playing in IPL: Joe Root
144.article_body: England batter Joe Root said that he hopes to get exposure of playing in the IPL. "I would certainly debate going into the IPL draw quite seriously...It would be great to get involved," Root said. He added, "The next couple of years, might be a good time to explore playing a little bit more of that format (T20)."

145.title: Tribals stand with BJP today as previous Cong govts did not work: Shah
145.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said that Gujarat has seen development in every field under BJP. Addressing a rally in Gujarat's Narmada, Shah said, "Previous Congress governments did not work nearly as much in decades as PM Modi [did] for the empowerment of tribals." He added, "This is why our tribal brothers and sisters today stand firmly with the BJP."

146.title: Will screw everyone's happiness if I go back in 'Bigg Boss 16': Gautam
146.article_body: Gautam Vig, who was recently evicted from 'Bigg Boss 16', was asked if he would like to enter the show as a wildcard. "I'll go again as a wildcard because I've seen a lot of things after coming out...I'm gonna screw everyone's happiness if I go back as a wildcard," he stated. Gautam said Shiv Thakare would win the show.

147.title: Lost my voice a day before concert, still managed to perform for 3 hrs: Shreya
147.article_body: Singer Shreya Ghoshal, who's on a USA tour, revealed that she lost her voice "completely" on November 18, after performing in Orlando. "With...prayers of my well-wishers and my doctor Sameer Bhargava's care, I could bring my voice back to be able to sing...full 3-hour concert for...packed New York arena," she added. Shreya performed in New York on November 19.

148.title: Suspended Andaman Labour Commissioner held in gang-rape case
148.article_body:
Suspended Andaman and Nicobar Islands Labour Commissioner RL Rishi was on Monday arrested in connection with the gang-rape of a 21-year-old woman, police said.
So far, three accused have been arrested in the case, including former Andaman and Nicobar Chief Secretary Jitendra Narain and a Port Blair-based businessman. A special investigation team (SIT) has questioned Narain thrice.

149.title: Nursery admissions in Delhi schools to start on December 1
149.article_body: Application process for nursery admissions in private schools in Delhi will begin on December 1, which is two weeks earlier than last year. All private schools will have to upload their admission criteria by November 28. Schools will issue first list of selected candidates and the waiting list on January 20. The second list will be issued on February 2.

150.title: Who are the 10 most-followed people on Instagram as Ronaldo hits 500 mn followers?
150.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has become the first person to have 500 million followers on Instagram. Lionel Messi is the second most-followed person with 376 million followers. Kylie Jenner comes in next, followed by Selena Gomez, Dwayne Johnson, Ariana Grande, Kim Kardashian, Beyoncé, Khloé Kardashian and Justin Bieber. Virat Kohli is the most-followed Indian on Instagram and 17th worldwide.

151.title: Turkey says 3 killed in Kurdish rocket strikes launched from Syria
151.article_body: Kurdish militants launched rocket strikes on Turkey from Syria on Monday, killing at least three people and wounding 10 others, Turkish officials said. The rockets reportedly struck a school and two houses in the border town of Karkamis, as well as a truck. This comes following Turkey's airstrikes targeting Kurdish militant bases in Syria and Iraq on Saturday and Sunday.

152.title: Indian-origin woman pleads guilty to assaulting, starving house help to death in S'pore
152.article_body: A 64-year-old Indian-origin woman named Prema S Naraynasamy has pleaded guilty to 48 charges of voluntarily causing hurt to her daughter's house helper Piang Ngaih Don. The 24-year-old Myanmarese victim was allegedly kicked, punched, slapped and starved by Prema, resulting in her death. CCTV footage reportedly showed Piang being abused till she died in July 2016.

153.title: I haven't done heartfelt 'Aashiqui' kind of love story: Rakul Preet
153.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about the films she would like to do in the future, has said that she would like to do a love story. "I haven't done a heartfelt 'Aashiqui' kind of love story that still wrenches my heart," she added. The actress further stated that she also would like to do an "out-and-out" comedy film.

154.title: Toxic gas leaks in cold drink manufacturing unit in WB; several fall ill
154.article_body: Several workers of a cold drink manufacturing unit fell ill after the leakage of toxic gas in West Bengal's Kamalgazi area on Monday. Two firefighters also fell ill during the rescue operation in the area. "Going by the pungent smell of the gas it seems to be ammonia. We have a team of doctors with us," an officer said.

155.title: NCP, Sena protest in Pune against Maha Guv's remarks on Shivaji
155.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena faction protested in Pune against Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari's remarks on Chhatrapati Shivaji. At a programme, Koshyari called Shivaji an 'old idol' of Maharashtra and said, "You can find new (idols), from Babasaheb Ambedkar to Nitin Gadkari." The protesters demanded that Koshyari be removed as Governor.

156.title: Pune residents ask PMC to open more gym facilities
156.article_body: Residents of Pune have asked the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to increase the number of gymnasium facilities. During the COVID-19 pandemic, PMC shut down all gymnasium facilities and resumed only 34 gyms after March 2022, of which, only 30 are functional. "We don't have any plans of opening separate gyms as of now," said Santosh Varule, Deputy Commissioner Sports, PMC.

157.title: China signs $60 bn LNG deal with Qatar, one of the biggest ever
157.article_body: China has signed a $60 billion agreement for purchases of liquefied natural gas from Qatar. Qatar Energy will send China's Sinopec 4 million tonnes of LNG yearly from 2026, the state-controlled companies announced, making it one of China's biggest imports in terms of volume. The deal will reportedly last for 27 years, making it China's longest LNG supply agreement ever.

158.title: Iran fans boo national anthem, players don't sing it at 2022 FIFA WC in protest
158.article_body: The players of Iran's national football team refused to sing national anthem ahead of their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against England in Qatar's Doha on Monday. It was in an apparent show of support for anti-government protestors back home. Iran fans also booed the national anthem, with some seen making thumbs-down gestures.

159.title: MP man arrested for sending death threats to Kumar Vishwas
159.article_body: A 39-year-old man has been arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Indore for allegedly sending death-threat emails to poet-politician Kumar Vishwas. The accused had allegedly sent multiple emails to Vishwas over the last few days, Kumar Vishwas' manager said in a police complaint. The man had also allegedly made objectionable comments about Lord Ram.

160.title: Firetruck hit by plane was on planned drill: Lima airport operator
160.article_body: The operator of Peru's Lima airport on Sunday claimed that a firetruck involved in a fatal collision with a passenger plane on Friday had been doing a pre-arranged emergency drill. Lima Airport Partners, the airport operator, said it was coordinating the drill with the air traffic authority. The firetruck had entered the runway for the same drill, it said.

161.title: Industry bodies suggest wider tax base, higher capex at pre-Budget meeting
161.article_body: Industry bodies pitched for widening the tax base, boosting private investments, consumption and employment creation at the first pre-Budget consultation meeting. Saket Dalmia of PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry said infrastructure investment must not be less than 10% of the GDP. Confederation of Indian Industry President, Sanjiv Bajaj, suggested increasing capex spending to ₹10 lakh crore.

162.title: Ex-soldier beaten by pantry staff on train in MP after argument over namaz
162.article_body: Retired soldier Vilas Naik was beaten by pantry car staff near Madhya Pradesh's Betul after an argument broke out between them over other passengers offering namaz on the train. Naik had objected to other passengers offering namaz, had begun reciting prayers and had stopped a pantry staff member. He was beaten by staff after pantry car's manager tried to intervene.

163.title: Aishwarya remembers late dad on his birth anniversary, shares post
163.article_body: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan took to Instagram to remember her late father Krishnaraj Rai on his birth anniversary. She shared a picture of herself and daughter Aaradhya as they posed in front of his picture. "Prayers and love in remembrance. Happy birthday dearest darling daddy," Aishwarya captioned the post. Krishnaraj Rai passed away in 2017.

164.title: Woman poses as IAS officer on FB, cheats K'taka man of ₹40 lakh
164.article_body: A 30-year-old Karnataka man was allegedly cheated of ₹40 lakh by a woman who lied about getting selected for the IAS. According to reports, he met the accused on Facebook and transferred money to her as and when she asked. He borrowed ₹32 lakh from colleagues and his father, police said, adding that he also sold a piece of land.

165.title: Chargesheet in DAV school rape case by November end: Hyd Police
165.article_body: The Banjara Hills police said they would file the chargesheet in the DAV school rape case by November-end. Police said they found no evidence in the school's darkroom and hence will rely on the accused's confession. The incident, which took place on October 17, came to light when the 4-year-old complained of pain in her private parts.

166.title: SS Rajamouli meets 'Mission Impossible' director Abrams in LA, fans react
166.article_body: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli met filmmaker JJ Abrams, who is known for films like 'Star Wars' and 'Mission Impossible III', at the Governors Awards in Los Angeles. The official Twitter account of 'RRR' shared the picture of both directors on the social media platform. Several fans reacted to the picture. One of the users tweeted, "Pride of Indian cinema."

167.title: EaseMyTrip shares jump 20% as it turns ex-date for split, bonus issue
167.article_body: Online travel agency EaseMyTrip's shares surged 20% after they turned ex-date for 3:1 bonus issue, and 1:1 stock split. The board of directors of Easy Trip Planner, which operates EaseMyTrip, announced November 22 as record date for the stock split and bonus issue to "reward shareholders". EaseMyTrip shares hit an intraday high of ₹57.30 apiece.

168.title: Essar completes $2 bn sale of port, assets to Arcelor Mittal Nippon Steel
168.article_body: Essar group said it has concluded the sale of captive ports and power assets to Arcelor Mittal Nippon Steel India for $2.05 billion. With the sale, Essar has completed its asset monetisation programme to effectively become debt free. The sale consisted of infra assets, including a 270 MW power plant and ports at Hazira, Gujarat, and Paradip, Odisha.

169.title: No box office competition between Black Panther 2 & Black Adam: Dwayne
169.article_body:
Actor Dwayne Johnson reacted to a report on Twitter which stated that the box office collection of Marvel's 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' has surpassed Dwayne's 'Black Adam'. "What a neutral post. 
I love competing...there's no competition with the established global brand of 'Black Panther' compared to 'Black Adam'...who a year ago no one even heard of," he tweeted.

170.title: It was the best I've seen her play: Sathiyan on Manika's Asian Cup bronze
170.article_body: Having watched world number 44 Manika Batra beat some of the higher-ranked players on way to her Asian Cup bronze medal, her mixed doubles partner Sathiyan Gnanasekaran said it was the best he has seen her play. "She's always had the potential to beat...top players in the world...I think she's now starting to play at her best," he added.

171.title: Man kills wife after she refuses to give earrings in Palghar
171.article_body: A man allegedly killed his wife after the latter refused to give her earrings to pay for the rituals of the former's dead mother in Palghar, Maharashtra. The incident happened as the accused's mother had died a few days ago and he had mortgaged his wife's jewellery to conduct the funeral, police said. Notably, the accused is still absconding.

172.title: Jio gets NCLT's approval for acquisition of Reliance Infratel
172.article_body: The NCLT gave its approval to Reliance Jio for the acquisition of Reliance Infratel that owns tower and fibre assets of Reliance Communications. NCLT has asked Jio to deposit ₹3,720 crore in the SBI escrow account to complete the acquisition of the assets. The Committee of Creditors approved the resolution plan by Jio in March 2020 with a 100% vote.

173.title: BJP's sting video claiming AAP sold MCD tickets for money is fake: MLA
173.article_body: AAP MLA Dilip Pandey on Monday said that the sting operation video shared by BJP claiming that the party sold MCD tickets for ₹80 lakh is "fake". The video was purportedly shot by former AAP leader Bindu, from whom the party demanded ₹80 lakh for an MCD ticket, claimed BJP leader Sambit Patra.

174.title: Aiming for more divestments in next 12 to 24 months: Tata Power CEO
174.article_body: Tata Power Chief Executive Officer Praveer Sinha said the company is aiming for more divestments in the next 12 to 24 months after inducting new investors into its renewable energy business. He added that the company is trying to extend the interim arrangement to import coal for its subsidiary Coastal Gujarat Power. The arrangement expires on December 31.

175.title: Tamil Nadu record biggest-ever victory in 50-over cricket history
175.article_body: Tamil Nadu on Monday recorded the biggest-ever victory in List A (50-over) cricket history. Tamil Nadu set the world record by defeating Arunachal Pradesh by 435 runs in a Vijay Hazare Trophy match. The previous record was set by Somerset, who had defeated Devon by 346 runs in 1990.
