351.article_body: Jason David Frank, best known as Tommy Oliver or the Green Ranger of 'Power Rangers', passed away at the age of 49 in Texas. TMZ, citing sources, reported that he died by suicide. The actor's representative said, "Please respect the privacy of his family and friends during this horrible time as we come to terms with his loss."

352.title: Suryakumar is a player that can hit and hurt you in many areas: Southee
352.article_body: New Zealand pacer Tim Southee said India batter Suryakumar Yadav's "exceptional" innings was miles apart from anything else his side saw in second T20I. "He's a player that can hit...and hurt you in a number of areas. He's had a great 12-18 months in IPL, international cricket. Came up against a pretty impressive knock today," he added. Suryakumar hit 111*(51).

353.title: More to life than racing in circles, feeling a bit empty: Sebastian Vettel
353.article_body: Four-time world champion Sebastian Vettel said there was more to life than "racing in circles" as he retired from F1 at the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. "I enjoyed the race...once the lights go off its full-on race mode," said Vettel. He added that he felt "a bit empty" after the race and will "miss more than" he 'understands'.

354.title: BJP-JJP govt in Haryana has pushed state into debt trap: Hooda
354.article_body: Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda said the BJP-JJP government in Haryana has pushed the state into a debt trap with its "wrong economic policies". "The government's...policies have pushed the total debt...to ₹3,11,779 crore," he said. He added that in the last eight years, no medical college, national-level institute, railway line or big project has come up in Haryana.

355.title: President Droupadi Murmu undergoes cataract surgery in right eye
355.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu underwent cataract surgery in her right eye at the Army Hospital (Referral and Research) in Delhi on Sunday, the Rashtrapati Bhavan said. The surgery was successful and she has been discharged from the hospital. President Murmu, 64, had undergone cataract surgery in her left eye at the same Army Hospital on October 16 this year.

356.title: India's CEC Rajiv Kumar observes general elections in Nepal
356.article_body: India's Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar led a four-member delegation to observe Nepal's general elections. Nepal is voting to elect a new parliament and provincial assemblies. On Sunday, polls were held to elect 275 members of the House of Representatives and 550 seats of the seven Provincial Assemblies. To supervise the polls, 46 organisations were assigned.

357.title: Why waste votes on Congress: PM Modi at Gujarat poll rally
357.article_body: While addressing a poll rally in Gujarat's Amreli, Prime Minister Narendra Modi appealed to the people to not waste their votes on Congress considering that it did not have a roadmap for development. "The Opposition party can never do anything good for you," PM Modi said and added that a "Congress leader cannot take the path of development".

358.title: Mahatma Gandhi wanted Congress to stop being a party: Ram Madhav
358.article_body: BJP leader Ram Madhav said Mahatma Gandhi wanted Congress to work towards attaining social, economic, and moral freedom instead of as a political party after attaining Independence from the British. He added that Congress leaders had stopped listening to Mahatma Gandhi. "Gandhi Ji's wish...seems to be fulfilled by another Gandhi," said Madhav in a veiled criticism of Rahul Gandhi.

359.title: Canada sanctions Haiti's former Prez, 2 ex-PMs for financing gangs
359.article_body: Canada has sanctioned Haiti's former President Michel Martelly and two former Haitian PMs for their roles in financing gangs, Canada's ambassador to Haiti said on Sunday. In September, Haitian gangs created a humanitarian crisis by blocking a fuel terminal for nearly six weeks. Canada, along with the US and the UN, has sanctioned political leaders who allegedly financed the gangs.

360.title: We don't want him to leave: Mac Allister on Messi retiring from int'l football
360.article_body: Argentina midfielder Ale Mac Allister said his side doesn't want Lionel Messi to leave the national team as the seven-time Ballon d'Or winner revealed last month that the World Cup in Qatar 2022 would be his last. "He's very important for us, for the country. So hopefully, he is not [retiring]," he added. Argentina will face Saudi Arabia on Tuesday.

361.title: Indonesian edtech startup Ruangguru lays off hundreds of employees
361.article_body: Tiger Global-backed Indonesian edtech startup Ruangguru said it laid off hundreds of employees amid a deteriorating global economy. While the company didn't specify the number of employees who will lose jobs, it said it will provide severance pay and other compensation. "We apologise for our failure to predict and anticipate the rapidly developing economic situation," Ruangguru founders said.

362.title: BSF fire at, push back 2 Pakistani drones near International Border
362.article_body: A drone from Pakistan was spotted close to the international border in the Kassowal area of Punjab's Gurdaspur district. The unmanned aerial vehicle flew back to Pakistan after BSF personnel fired at least 96 rounds at the drone and also used five illumination bombs. BSF fired at and pushed back another drone in Amritsar district's Channa Patan area on Saturday.

363.title: Marriage with Muslim minor not excluded from POCSO: Kerala HC
363.article_body: Kerala High Court ruled that marriage with a Muslim minor isn't excluded from the POCSO Act. "If one of the parties to the marriage is a minor...offences under the POCSO Act will apply," Justice Bechu Kurian Thomas ruled. He was hearing the bail plea of a man accused of raping and then marrying a 16-year-old girl.

364.title: Ex-lover arrested for chopping woman's body in 6 pieces in UP
364.article_body: A former lover of a woman has been arrested for killing the woman and chopping her body in six pieces, officials said. The man was hit by a bullet in a gunfire encounter when he was taken to the spot of crime for recovering the woman's head. The woman's chopped body was found in a well on November 15.

365.title: Formula 1 journalist doesn't recognise Ranveer Singh in Abu Dhabi, video goes viral
365.article_body: A video went viral showing F1 journalist and ex-racing driver Martin John Brundle failing to recognise actor Ranveer Singh in Abu Dhabi. While interviewing Ranveer during his grid walk at Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, Brundle asked Ranveer to introduce himself as he couldn't recognise him. Ranveer responded, "I'm a Bollywood actor and I hail from Mumbai, India. I'm an entertainer."

366.title: MP govt to move SC against relief to interfaith couples
366.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government decided to move the Supreme Court to challenge the high court's interim order restraining it from prosecuting interfaith couples getting married without informing the district magistrate. A division bench called Section 10 of the anti-conversion act "unconstitutional". Petitioners sought interim relief against prosecution under the MP Freedom of Religion Act (MPFRA).

367.title: US' Alabama fails to execute convict; 3rd such instance since 2018
367.article_body: The US state of Alabama called off the execution of a death row inmate after prison officials failed to find a suitable vein to inject the lethal drugs late Thursday. Kenneth Eugene Smith's death warrant expired later at midnight. Smith's uncompleted execution was Alabama's second failed execution attempt in the past two months and the third since 2018.

368.title: 48 vehicles damaged in accident on Pune-Bengaluru highway, many feared injured
368.article_body: A major accident occurred at Navale bridge on the Pune-Bengaluru highway in which around 48 vehicles got damaged, officials said. Rescue teams from the Pune Fire Brigade and Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) have reached the spot, officials added. Multiple persons are feared to be injured in the accident.

369.title: I haven't done anything: Man whose identity Mangaluru blast suspect stole
369.article_body: Indian Railways employee Premraj Hutagi, whose identity Mangaluru blast suspect Mohammed Shariq stole, said he hasn't done anything and he's "innocent". "I never imagined that my name and [Aadhaar] card will be misused to this extent...I got to know about the explosion from police...I've been in constant fear since then," Hutagi added. He had lost his Aadhaar card twice earlier.

370.title: Rishabh Pant should look to time the ball, not hit it hard: Nehra
370.article_body: Former India cricketer Ashish Nehra said Rishabh Pant should look to time the ball, rather than hitting it hard. "Pant did not look in good touch...want to see how much does this opening pair (of Pant and Ishan Kishan) gets backed by the team management," said Nehra. Pant scored six of 13 balls during the second T20I against New Zealand.

371.title: What he's doing is really special: Karthik on Suryakumar's ton vs NZ
371.article_body: Praising India batter Suryakumar Yadav following his 111* runs in 51 balls against New Zealand in Mount Maunganui, Dinesh Karthik said, "What he's doing is really special." He added that using the pace consistently and the ability to hit on both sides of the wicket comes naturally to the 32-year-old. Suryakumar hit 11 fours and seven sixes during his knock.

372.title: I hate Trump but that doesn't change freedom of speech rules: Elon's brother
372.article_body: Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk reacted to former US President Donald Trump's return to Twitter by tweeting, "I hate Trump to the bottom of my soul (is that hate speech? I’m sorry)." Kimbal added, "That doesn't change freedom of speech rules that have been carefully and successfully formed since America's founding." Kimbal's remarks come after Trump's Twitter account was reinstated.

373.title: 3 killed, 1 hurt after car rams into truck on Bareilly-Nainital road
373.article_body: Three persons, including a woman, died on the spot and another person was seriously injured when a car rammed into a truck on the Bareilly-Nainital road on Sunday, police said. The injured person was rushed to a private hospital, where he is undergoing treatment, Bareilly Superintendent of Police (SP) said.

374.title: Logan Sargeant earns F1 Super License to race for Williams in 2023
374.article_body: American racing driver Logan Sargeant has earned the Super License he needs to race for Williams F1 in the 2023 season. Sargeant, who needed to finish at least sixth, came fourth in Formula Two to qualify for the F1 Super License. Sargeant, who will partner with Alex Albon, takes over the race seat occupied this year by Canadian Nicholas Latifi.

375.title: Why do Denmark's FIFA jerseys have black & other 'toned down' colours?
375.article_body: Denmark have decided to wear 'toned down' FIFA World Cup 2022 jerseys to protest Qatar's human rights record. Danish FIFA kit provider Hummel designed a kit completely in black or the "colour of mourning", apart from red and white. Hummel said it "does not wish to be visible" in the tournament over the alleged cost to human lives.

376.title: Tabu is the golden girl of the industry right now: Kiara Advani
376.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, when asked about being the golden girl of Bollywood, said, "Right now, (the golden girl of the industry) is Tabu ma'am after the success of Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 and Drishyam 2." "She has taken over," Kiara added. 'Drishyam 2' has collected ₹36.97 crore in India within two days of its release.

377.title: Tabassum ji used to tease me about my girlfriends back in the day: Shatrughan
377.article_body: Shatrughan Sinha, remembering late actress Tabassum, said she was a "lively, sharp and good human being". "She would always tease me because I used to stay just next door...She used to send messages and tease me about my girlfriends visiting my house, back in the day," he added. Tabassum passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest on Friday.

378.title: Vietnam man who questioned pandemic response gets 8 years in jail
378.article_body: A 41-year-old man was handed an eight-year prison sentence for "anti-state activities" by a court in Vietnam's Thanh Hoa province on Friday after a two-day trial. Bui Van Thuan was detained after he posted a comment on Facebook questioning the administration's handling of the pandemic. He'll be placed under house arrest for five years following his release, Thuan's lawyers said.

379.title: 'Govinda...' is different film, we're very proud of it: Karan Johar
379.article_body: Producer Karan Johar, speaking about Vicky Kaushal-starrer 'Govinda Naam Mera', has said that the film is "very different" and added that they are "very proud" of it. "I'm always looking for a good story and when that comes on my table, I get excited," he further added. 'Govinda Naam Mera' also features Bhumi Pednekar and Kiara Advani.

380.title: Decriminalise GST law, reduce personal income tax rates: CII to govt
380.article_body: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has asked the government to decriminalise the GST in the forthcoming Budget. CII argued that the GST law already contains adequate penal provisions for deterrence against taxes' evasion. CII President Sanjiv Bajaj further demanded a reduction in personal income tax rates, saying, "This would increase disposable incomes and revive the demand cycle."

381.title: Ecuador's Enner Valencia scores first goal of 2022 FIFA World Cup through penalty
381.article_body: Ecuador's 33-year-old striker Enner Valencia scored the first goal of 2022 FIFA World Cup by converting a penalty in 16th minute against hosts Qatar in the opener at the Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor. Earlier, in the third minute of the match, Valencia had scored a goal through a header, but it didn't count as it was ruled offside.

382.title: Aus best team to play with before World Cup: Ind hockey skipper
382.article_body: Indian skipper Harmanpreet Singh said that Australia is the best team to play with before the FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023 in January in Odisha. "Good opportunity to try new things. What works for us and what does not...Even a practice match can help us get better. All matches before the World Cup are important," Harmanpreet said.

383.title: Was hungry to do film where I didn't have to cry: Vicky on 'Govinda...'
383.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal, speaking about his film 'Govinda Naam Mera', has said that he was "hungry" to do a film where he did not have to cry. "In this film, the suffering has finally ended. I was very happy," he further added. Bhumi Pednekar and Kiara Advani also feature in the film, which is directed by Shashank Khaitan.

384.title: Car overturns after driver suffers heart attack in Himachal; 11 injured
384.article_body: A car overturned after its driver suffered a heart attack and lost control of the vehicle in Himachal Pradesh's Una district on Sunday, injuring 11 passengers. The villagers took the injured persons to a hospital and two women with severe injuries were taken to a hospital in Chandigarh. All the passengers were returning to their homes in the car.

385.title: Extremely disappointing: Saif on performance of 'Vikram Vedha' at box office
385.article_body: Saif Ali Khan said that it was "extremely disappointing" for him to witness the poor box office performance of his film 'Vikram Vedha'. On being asked about the majority of Bollywood films not performing at the box office, he said, "I've no idea but something is happening." 'Vikram Vedha' was a remake of 2017 Tamil film of the same name.

386.title: 'Adipurush' is part of our history, is extremely important: Kriti Sanon
386.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon, speaking about her film 'Adipurush', has said, "It's a film which is of the grand canvas, it's a part of our history...is extremely important." "It needs to be put out in the right way...in the best possible way because that's what Om Raut...had envisioned," she added. The film's teaser was trolled over its VFX on Twitter.

387.title: Was offered the role of a psycho: Kalki on being stereotyped
387.article_body: Actress Kalki Koechlin has said that she has been stereotyped in her roles, and it has been frustrating. "I can kind of relate to being...sidekick, the best friend who's funny but annoying or just somebody who's not...likeable or...home-breaker," she said. "A director once approached me for a role saying 'you're going to love this...because it's about a psycho'," Kalki added.

388.title: My main focus is to win TT medal at Olympics: Manika Batra
388.article_body: Indian table tennis player Manika Batra, who recently became the first-ever Indian woman to win a medal at Asian Cup, said her main focus is to win a medal at Olympics and beat top players over there. India have never won a table tennis medal at Olympics. Manika won a bronze medal at recently concluded Asian Cup in Bangkok.

389.title: Previous UP govts 'criminalised politics', 'politicised crime': CM Yogi
389.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that previous state governments "criminalised politics" and "politicised crime". "Security is the top priority for us," CM Yogi said at an event in UP's Saharanpur district. He added, "The state, where hooliganism was at its peak and people were migrating and communal clashes took place every three to four days, has become riot-free today."

390.title: Partnerships required for chasing such target: Southee after loss to India
390.article_body: New Zealand seamer Tim Southee commented on the 65-run-loss against India. "Just not able to get going. When you are chasing such a target you need partnerships at some stage," Southee said. India had set a target of 192 runs in the second T20I at Mount Maunganui on Sunday. Notably, Southee clinched a hat-trick in the match.

391.title: Suryakumar's innings was miles apart from other batters: Southee
391.article_body: New Zealand bowler Tim Southee commented on Indian batter Suryakumar Yadav's match-winning century in the second T20I on Sunday. "His (Suryakumar) innings was miles apart from what we saw today from others. His innings took the score to more than what we were hoping for today. Exceptional innings," Southee said. Notably, Yadav scored an unbeaten 111 off 51 balls.

392.title: Hopefully Test cap will come soon: Suryakumar after his 2nd T20I ton
392.article_body: After his unbeaten 111(51) helped India beat New Zealand by 65 runs in second T20I, India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who hasn't made his Test debut so far, said he's hoping that the Test cap will come soon. It was Suryakumar's second T20I ton. Suryakumar added that he has a fair idea about Test cricket, having played 77 first-class matches.

393.title: Heartiest congratulations: Anurag Thakur to Manika on her Asian Cup bronze
393.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur congratulated Manika Batra after the paddler became the first-ever Indian woman to win a medal at Asian Cup. "Heartiest congratulations Manika for creating history," he wrote on Twitter. World number 44 Manika defeated world number six Hina Hayata of Japan 4-2 to win a bronze medal at Asian Cup in Bangkok on Saturday.

394.title: Canadian spy agency investigating death threats from Iran
394.article_body: The Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) is probing several death threats from Iran to people living in Canada on the basis of "credible intelligence", the agency said in a statement. The threats are "designed to silence those who speak out publicly" against Iran, it added. CSIS said it was working closely with Iranian-Canadian communities which had been targeted  "disproportionately".

395.title: Company to blame for broken ribs, sliced ear, crushed hand: Rivian's US employees
395.article_body: American electric vehicle maker Rivian has been accused of safety violations at its Illinois plant by a dozen employees. They allege that the company ignored known hazards and deprioritised safety resources, resulting in a crushed hand, a broken foot, a sliced ear and broken ribs. The employees also allege they were forced to share respirators required during the manufacturing process.

396.title: 55-yr-old man killed, body chopped into pieces allegedly by son in West Bengal
396.article_body: A 55-year-old man was killed and his body was allegedly cut into pieces and dumped in various places by his son in West Bengal. The wife and college-going son of the man, who retired from the Navy 12 years ago, were arrested in connection with the crime on Saturday. The mother-son duo claimed to be "continuously tortured" by the man.

397.title: I'll be stupid to even think of a special shot in Suryakumar's 111*: Shastri
397.article_body: On being asked to choose a special shot in Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 111 off 51 balls against New Zealand in second T20I, Ravi Shastri said, "I'll be stupid to even try and think of a special shot because they were all special." "Last 64 runs came in just 18 deliveries, which is mind-boggling," he stated. India won by 65 runs.

398.title: In pics: 2022 FIFA World Cup opening ceremony in Qatar
398.article_body: The 2022 FIFA World Cup kicked off in Qatar on Sunday. The opening ceremony of the tournament featured a performance by American actor Morgan Freeman. It also featured a performance of a new tournament song called Dreamers featuring singer Jungkook of K-pop boy band BTS. Qatar is hosting and participating in a FIFA World Cup for the first time.

399.title: Video shows women in Rajasthan beating panchayat member for misbehaving
399.article_body: A video showing women beating a panchayat member with sticks in Rajasthan's Bharatpur for misbehaving with them has surfaced. Panchayat members had arrived at the scene to solve a land dispute and allegedly display their authority. The Panchayat Samiti member, Rohtash Meena, was beaten by women while other villagers tried to stop them. The women also tore Meena's clothes.

400.title: Woman killed, 2 injured as elephant demolishes house in Tamil Nadu
400.article_body: A 58-year-old woman was killed and two others were injured after an elephant demolished their house in Tamil Nadu's Gudalur, forest officials said on Sunday. The incident took place around midnight on Saturday when the animal strayed into the human habitat while looking for food. Officials added that they are trying to drive the elephant back into the forest.

401.title: Centre appoints 10 new Executive Directors for public sector banks
401.article_body: The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved the appointment of ten Executive Directors (ED) in various Public Sector Banks. Lalit Tyagi, Chief General Manager of Bank of Baroda, has been appointed as ED of the same bank for three years. Punjab National Bank's Binod Kumar has been named the ED for the same bank for three years as well.

402.title: Air India allows crew to extend tenure under voluntary retirement
402.article_body: Tata Group-owned Air India has given its employees, including the cabin crew who opted for the voluntary retirement scheme (VRS), the option to extend their tenure until January 31, 2023 amid reports of shortage of staff. The release date for those who had opted for the VRS was November 30, 2022. Reportedly, 4,500 staff had applied for the scheme.

403.title: JP Nadda holds roadshow in Delhi, says 'people are tired of AAP govt'
403.article_body: Ahead of the MCD elections in Delhi, BJP's National President JP Nadda on Sunday held a roadshow in the national capital. "The people of Delhi are tired of the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government. It's a government which is drowned in corruption," Nadda said during the roadshow. "The number of people gathered here indicates that BJP will be blessed," he added.
